SEARCH
Package edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.comp

Class ProblemCompiler

java.lang.Object
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.comp.ProblemCompiler
public class ProblemCompiler extends Object
A problem compiler is a data structure for converting fluents, events, and logical expressions into compiled fluents, compiled events, and logical expressions using compiled elements. Problem compilers are generally used to create the elements of a compiled problem.
Author:
Stephen G. Ware

    • compile

      public <T> T compile(T original)
      Compiles an object, replacing it or its parts with compiled elements. For example, fluents are replaced with compiled fluents, and logical expressions that contain fluents will return an equivalent logical expression with its fluents replaced with compiled fluents. This method accepts a wide variety of objects, including compiled and non-compiled fluents, compiled and non-compiled events, and various logical expressions that are needed to create the preconditions and effects of events in disjunctive normal form.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of object to be compiled
      Parameters:
      original - the object to compile
      Returns:
      a compiled replacement for the object

    • compile

      public final <I extends Expression, O extends Expression> CompiledMapping<O> compile(Mapping<I> original, Function<I,O> function)
      Converts a mapping to a compiled mapping.
      Type Parameters:
      I - the type of expression returned by the original mapping
      O - the type of expression the compiled mapping will return
      Parameters:
      original - the original mapping
      function - a function which maps expressions from the original mapping to expressions to be returned by the new mapping
      Returns:
      a compiled mapping
